summary: Tech stocks mixed late Wednesday afternoon with the Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK) up . Tech stocks were mixed late on Wednesday afternoon .

Microsoft-backed (MSFT) OpenAI, which is proceeding with a corporate restructuring that requires the company to be restructured . OpenAI is the brainchild of OpenAI's founder, founder of the company OpenAI .
Microsoft-backed (MSFT) OpenAI said Wednesday it is expanding its Stargate initiative working to improve AI . The Stargate project is based on the Stargate AI initiative, which is based in China .

Microsoft's Intelligent Cloud segment emerged as the company's primary growth engine, with Azure and other cloud services revenues surging 33% . The tech giant's strategic investments in artificial intelligence are yielding substantial returns, positioning the stock as a compelling buy opportunity for investors seeking exposure to the transformative potential of AI technology .  During the quarter, Microsoft processed more than 100 trillion tokens, representing a fivefold increase year over year . Microsoft processed a record 50 trillion tokens in March alone . This exponential growth in AI workloads underscores the accelerating demand for Microsoft's AI infrastructure and services .  Google's Isomorphic Labs secured $600 million for AI drug discovery, leveraging its Nobel Prize-winning AlphaFold technology . Nvidia dominates the industrial AI space with its Omniverse Blueprint for manufacturing digital twins . Amazon unveiled Nova Act, an AI agent that controls web browsers .  Microsoft has outperformed the Zacks Computer & Technology sector with a 2.8% growth in the year-to-date period . The tech giant formed a $1 billion, seven-year partnership with WSP Global to accelerate digital transformation in the architecture, engineering, and construction industry .  Total revenues reached $70.1 billion, up 13% (15% in constant currency) year over year . Microsoft Cloud segment generated $42.4 billion in revenues, growing 21% . The company's ability to monetize AI across its diverse business segments provides multiple growth vectors that could drive future stock appreciation .  Microsoft's stellar third-quarter results position the company as a frontrunner in the AI race . Microsoft currently carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) Microsoft is well-positioned to capitalize on the accelerating enterprise AI adoption trend .  Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here . Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days . Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) and Google (GOOGL) are among the latest high-flying stocks .

The Dow Jones Industrial Average is a benchmark index of the top 30 companies in the US . It represents the strength of the US economy and carries great historical significance . Not all stocks within this elite group of companies perform equally . We decided to break down the index and find out the best and worst stocks .  The list is in ascending order, with the best stock taking the number one spot . rank to the company with the least short interest . rank . We then combined the two ranks to see which stock was the best on average .  Microsoft-backed AI startup OpenAI recently entered into a deal with The Washington Post to merge the newspaper's content into ChatGPT . The chatbot will provide links, summaries, and quotes to the Washington Post’s original articles . The firm surprised analysts with faster growth in cloud compared to its competitors .  There is an AI stock that went up since the beginning of 2025, while popular AI stocks lost around 25% . The cheapest AI stock trades at less than 5 times its earnings .

Microsoftexperienced a 20% price increase over the past month, partially supported by a range of strategic initiatives, including the national rollout of FarmBeats for Students and an integration with Inlayer Telematics . Microsoft's expanded collaboration with Board to leverage AI and deepen Azure integration further underscores its influence .  Microsoft's total shareholder return reached 148.04% over the past five years . Microsoft underperformed both the US Software industry and the broader US Market, which returned 14% and 7.2% . Microsoft's strategic alignment with Azure and AI expansion could enhance future revenue streams, supporting analysts' anticipation of annual revenue growth of 13.6% .  The recent 20% price increase in Microsoft's shares aligns with a robust earnings report and positive investor sentiment . Analysts have some disagreement, with bullish estimates as high as US$650 and bearish at US$415 . The current share price of US$394.04 remains below the analyst consensus price target .  Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned in this article . NasdaqGS:MSFT. Nasdaq GS: MSFT.

Jim Cramer commented on how market sentiment towards AI appeared to be changing . He also commented on the current tensions between the US and China regarding AI and overall trade . The US has restricted sales of advanced AI chips to China .  US AI chip sanctions have included restricting all but 18 countries from being able to acquire the latest AI chips . The laws were introduced under the Biden administration and Cramer's been their critic . Cramer added: "Some people now feel that they're going to offer licensing for a country which would really be bad. Worse than what Biden did"  Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT)'s stock appears to have turned around a corner since the firm's latest earnings report . The shares have gained 10% as management painted a positive picture of AI growth . AI growth and profitability have driven Microsoft Corporation's narrative since last year .  There is an AI stock that went up since the beginning of 2025, while popular AI stocks lost around 25% . If you are looking for an AI that is more promising than MSFT but that trades at less than 5 times its earnings, check out our report about thischeapest AI stock .

Seagate’s chief commercial officer, BS Teh, said the data storage firm aims to launch a drive with about three times the capacity of its top-notch hard drives by 2030 . Teh expressed conviction in strong demand, underlining the need for the 100-terabyte hard drive .  Seagate Technology Holdings stock gained close to 9% year-to-date . February reports indicated Meta Platforms, Inc. is in talks to build an AI data center campus that could exceed $200 billion in costs . Microsoft expects to spend $80 billion on data centers in fiscal 2025 .  Seagate Bets On Mega-Sized, Sustainable Drives As AI Sparks Record Data Demand . Seagate is the latest tech giant to be acquired by Seagate Technology .

The 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals upheld a lower judge's order that said the FTC was not entitled to a preliminary injunction blocking the deal . A three-judge panel unanimously ruled that the lower judge had applied the correct legal standards . The FTC, which enforces antitrust law, separately challenged the merger in an internal administrative action .  The Activision Blizzard transaction marked the largest-ever acquisition in the video gaming market . The FTC's lawsuit sought an order freezing the Activision transaction while the agency pursued its administrative challenge . The deal closed in late 2023 after competition authorities in the UK approved it .  The judge is weighing whether to grant a preliminary injunction . The judge's office is also weighing whether the judge should grant an injunction on the case .

Microsoft says it's embracing Google's open protocol for allowing AI "agents" to communicate with each other . On Wednesday, Microsoft announced that it would bring support for Google's Agent2Agent spec to two of its AI development platforms . Microsoft has also joined the A2A working group on GitHub to contribute to the protocol .  Once A2A support arrives, agents built using the platforms will be able to tap external agents for tasks . For example, a Microsoft agent could schedule a meeting while a Google agent drafts the email invites .  Microsoft's decision to throw its weight behind A2A comes after the company introduced support for MCP, Anthropic’s standard for connecting AI to the systems where data resides, in Copilot Studio .

OpenAI, backed by Microsoft, is expanding its Stargate AI project beyond U.S. soil . The goal? Offer an alternative to China's AI build-out and spread democratic AI values like free speech and open markets . France, the U.K. and Germany have already raised their hands .  The plan leans on Microsoft's Azure muscle and the U.S.'s AI lead to stitch together a global network of AI hubs . Each site will need to navigate local regulations, export rules and political sensitivities .  When countries start formally green-lighting Stargate projects, you'll know OpenAI is serious about growing its global footprint . This article first appeared on GuruFocus.com .

Microsoft has expanded a landmark carbon removal deal with Swedish energy company Stockholm Exergi . The revised agreement aims to remove 5.08 million metric tons of carbon dioxide produced by Microsoft over a 10-year period . Microsoft is aiming to become carbon negative by 2030 and remove all the carbon the company has emitted into the environment since it was founded .  Stockholm Exergi will build the facility at its existing biomass and heat power plant located in Värtan, Stockholm . The energy company previously said thebiomass feedstock will continue to be sourced in a sustainable way that is in line with Microsoft’s quality thresholds . Construction on the project is expected to begin this year .  Microsoft has expanded offtake of carbon removal technology to meet 2030 carbon negative goals . Microsoft has signed a deal with Stockholm Exergi to deploy new carbon removal technologies towards climate action . Microsoft: “We are pleased to announce this expansion offtake.”

Five companies offer strategic exposure to different aspects of the AI value chain . Economic forecasts project that AI could add $15.7 trillion to the global economy by 2030 . Unlike previous technological shifts, AI's unique capacity for autonomous learning, decision-making, and problem-solving creates exponential value .  AMD's MI325X AI accelerator boasts massive memory bandwidth and strong generative AI performance . Amazon.com, Inc. continues to lead in AI infrastructure through its Amazon Web Services (AWS) division .  In the consumer space, Amazon has integrated generative AI features across its platforms, with Nova Sonic already powering elements of Alexa+ and the widely available Rufus shopping assistant . Nova Sonic particularly stands out for its ability to understand speech in different speaking styles while generating natural-sounding responses .  ASML's unique position in the semiconductor supply chain makes it a pivotal player in the AI industry . Its functional monopoly on EUV lithography also gives the company a formidable economic moat .  Meta Platforms, Inc. has shifted from an AI underdog to a front-runner with the release of its Llama 4 family of open-source models . WhatsApp has emerged as the primary platform where users engage with Meta AI, driving most one-on-one AI interactions . Artificial intelligence has been an epic catalyst for the likes of Nvidia and many of its big tech peers . Amazon has witnessed a near-trillion-dollar surge in its own valuation during the AI revolution . While Nvidia has a higher market cap than Amazon today, the e-commerce giant could leapfrog its semiconductor counterpart the end of the decade .  Amazon reports its revenue across six major categories: e-commerce, physical stores, third-party seller services, advertising, subscriptions, and Amazon Web Services . While AI has the potential to disrupt all of Amazon's operational segments, AWS and retail are the two that have me most encouraged . I think the company could be worth much more than semiconductor giant by next decade .  Amazon is outfitting its fulfillment centers with robotic processes that can bring a new level of automation and efficiency to packaging and shipping services . Amazon should be able to reduce labor costs over time, resulting in greater profitability for its core retail operation .  Amazon is in the early phases of developing its own AI chips . Microsoft, Meta Platforms, and Alphabetare pursuing similar ambitions . While I don't think this will be catastrophic for Nvidia, it likely won't help it in the long run . Investors might want to prepare for less robust growth in Nvidia's sales and profits .  Amazon appears to be in the early stages of taking advantage of new opportunities for accelerated growth . Amazon's valuation trends suggest that investors are not yet placing much of a premium at all on the company's efficiency improvements or long-run potential . Amazon should be in a position to continue accelerating sales while minting billions in cash flow in the process . Microsoft’s cloud and AI businesses will keep growing for the foreseeable future . The cloud and artificial intelligence markets expanded rapidly over the past decade . Cloudflare, Five9 and Five9 could disrupt the traditional call center market .  From fiscal 2014 to fiscal 2024, Microsoft's revenue increased at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 11% . Analysts expect its revenue and EPS to both rise at a CAGR of 14% from fiscal 2024 to fiscal 2027 . Microsoft's Azure is the world's second largest cloud infrastructure platform after Amazon Web Services .  Cloudflare is one of the world's largest content delivery network (CDN) providers . CDNs accelerate the delivery of digital content for websites and apps by storing cached copies of that content on edge servers . They also shield websites from bot-based attacks with verification checks for their human users .  Cloudflare serves data from facilities in 335 cities in more than 125 countries . Analysts expect its revenue to grow at a CAGR of 27% from 2024 to 2027 . The stock isn't a bargain at 16 times next year's sales, but it's a straightforward way to profit from the cloud and AI markets .  Five9 now serves more than 3,000 enterprise, mid-market, and SMB customers worldwide . It handles over 14 billion call minutes every year . Analysts expect it to turn profitable this year and grow its EPS at a CAGR of 125% over the next two years . Microsoft, Apple, and Nvidia have the most realistic chance of reaching the $4 trillion club first . Microsoft is racing to fill a $315 billion order backlog from customers who need more computing capacity for their artificial intelligence (AI) ambitions . Nvidia might be much further away from the mark, but it could legitimately achieve the milestone .  Since 2019, Microsoft invested around $14 billion in AI start-up OpenAI . Microsoft combined OpenAI's latest AI models with its own to create the Copilot virtual assistant . Copilot is now integrated into the company's flagship software products like Windows, Bing, and Edge, for free . It's available for subscribers of the 365 productivity suite for an additional monthly fee .  Microsoft said there were hundreds of thousands of organizations using Copilot for 365 around the world . CEO Satya Nadella said a record number of customers opted to buy more licenses during the quarter . The company rolled out new Copilot features to encourage more subscribers to upgrade .  Microsoft accounts for its AI cloud revenue under its Azure AI segment . Azure AI accounted for a record-high 16 percentage points (almost half) of that figure . The company opened new data centers in 10 countries in the third quarter alone .  Microsoft allocated $21.4 billion to capital expenditures (capex) during the third quarter, most of which went toward data center infrastructure . Microsoft is trading at a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 33.6 as of this writing . It's sitting roughly between Apple stock, which trades at a P/E ratio of 31.9 and Nvidia stock .  Microsoft is growing its EPS below trend at the moment, partly because of its enormous data center spending which is weighing on its profitability . According to Wall Street's consensus estimate, the company could increase its earnings by 12.8% in fiscal 2026 .  The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years . Consider when Netflixmade this list on December 17, 2004... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $611,589! The Motley Fool’s total average return is894% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to163%for the S&P 500 .  Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock to Buy Before It Soars Into the $4 Trillion Club . The company is expected to be worth $4 trillion in 2014 .

Apple cautioned investors that steep import tariffs will take a toll on profits beginning this quarter . iPhone sales remain lethargic, with last quarter’s measurable growth mostly rooted in unusual circumstances . Tariffs are arguably the least of Apple's problems right now, if you dig deeper into its historical results .  Apple turned $95.4 billion in revenue into earnings of $1.65 per share in fiscal Q3 . The iPhone accounted for roughly half of Apple's business, with sales of $46.8 billion . The company's services arm continues to shine as well .  iPhone unit sales of the iPhone improved 10% year over year, but that's a 10% improvement on a figure that fell by nearly as much in the comparable quarter a year earlier . Actual iPhone revenue remains more or less in line with where it peaked in 2022 .  The iPhone accounts for half of Apple's sales, and presumably, a comparable percentage of its profits . Without this push, it's conceivable that last quarter's iPhone business might have actually fallen . Apple didn't embrace this next generation of AI chatbots in earnest until last year .  Apple's AI chief has been removed as head of Siri's ongoing development . Tim Cook was forced to concede during the recent earnings call that the implementation of a new-and-improved Siri is "just taking a bit longer than we thought" Apple is usually isolationist, and such a decision confirms just how far behind its AI efforts .  Apple is steering customers to its competitors on AI-powered virtual assistants . Does this spell doom? Hardly . If nothing else, Apple remains the world's most profitable company .  The bottom line? Apple isn't necessarily a sell here . There's even a wobbly case for stepping into the stock while it's down more than 20% from its December peak . Apple's services business also remains impressive, even if it's not its flagship business .  Stock Advisor’s total average return is894% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to163% for the S&P 500 . Consider when Netflixmade this list on December 17, 2004... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $611,589!  Tariffs are the least of Apple's problems right now, according to The Motley Fool . The company's stock has more than 1.6 million shares .

Nvidia dominates the artificial intelligence (AI) chip market, resulting in soaring revenue in recent quarters . Investors have worried about how upcoming U.S. tariffs on imports may hurt the economy -- and demand for Nvidia’s products .  President Donald Trump announced a plan to put in place a set of tariffs on imports from around the world . The concern is this will increase prices of items at home, weighing on consumers' wallets and companies' earnings . This potential hurdle put Nvidia to a test: Would its top customers, seeing the risk of a slowdown ahead, cut spending on AI .  Trump's initial tariff plan was put on pause to offer countries time to negotiate trade deals with the U.S. The president has temporarily exempted electronics products from the tariffs . It's too early to determine this impact, since final tariff levels haven't been set . The tech giants all face a certain degree of impact on future earnings prospects .  Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella: Cloud and AI are essential inputs for every business to expand output, reduce costs, and accelerate growth . Amazon said it continues to "invest very aggressively in AI" Alphabet reiterated that it plans $75 billion in capital spending this year and said its relationship with Nvidia is a "key advantage"  Top customers refuse to slow down their AI spending plans, even against a tumultuous economic backdrop . This means we should expect ongoing growth from Nvidia as these customers continue to seek out top-performing chips .  Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late to invest in Nvidia, Apple and Netflix . Right now, we’re issuing “Double Down” alerts for three incredible companies . There may not be another chance like this anytime soon .  The Motley Fool recommends the following options: long January 2026 $395 calls on Microsoft . Adria Ciminohas positions in Amazon, Meta Platforms, Microsoft, and Nvidia .

OpenAI currently has an agreement to share 20% of its top line with Microsoft . The AI company has told investors it expects to share 10% of revenue with its business partners, including Microsoft, by 2030 . Microsoft has not yet approved OpenAI's proposed restructuring plan .  Microsoft reportedly wants to ensure the new structure protects its multi-billion-dollar investment . Microsoft and OpenAI did not immediately return requests for comment .

Partnership expands FarmBeats for Students program to help grow next generation of farmers . Program integrating smart sensors, data science and artificial intelligence to teach precision agriculture in classrooms . Starting today, FFA teachers and students throughout the United States will receive a classroom set of . kits free of charge . No prior technical experience is required .  Gaining hands-on experience with machine automation, data science and AI will help American agricultural students remain competitive in the global market . Students build environmental sensor systems and use AI to monitor soil moisture and detect nutrient deficiencies .  Microsoft and FFA team up with FFA to bring FarmBeats for Students to students across the country . "Our partnership with Microsoft exemplifies the power of collaboration in addressing industry needs while fostering personal and professional growth among students," said FFA chief program officer .  FarmBeats for Students was developed by Microsoft, FFA and agriculture educators . The program aligns with the AI for K-12 initiative guidelines; Agriculture, Food and Natural Resources career standards; Computer Science Teachers Association standards; Common Core math standards .  Microsoft creates platforms and tools powered by AI to deliver innovative solutions that meet the evolving needs of our customers . The technology company is committed to making AI available broadly and doing so responsibly .

ChatGPT-maker has dialed back a significant restructuring plan, with its nonprofit parent retaining control . The move is likely to limit CEO Sam Altman's power over the firm . Microsoft changed terms of a deal with OpenAI in January . Microsoft wants access to OpenAI's technology beyond 2030 .  Microsoft has said it has "revenue sharing agreements that flow both ways" with OpenAI . Microsoft declined to comment on the report, while OpenAI did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment .

The market appears to be holding its breath, waiting for tomorrow’s Federal Reserve policy announcement . What Powell says, or doesn’t say, will likely determine near-term market direction . Some analysts are already making their bull case as we look toward the summer .  Wages rose 3.8% in April, while inflation (as measured by the Cleveland Fed) ran at just 2.3% for the month . Dominion provides electricity in Loudoun County, nicknamed ‘Data Center Alley’ because it hosts the largest cluster of data centers in the world . Big Tech companies are investing tens of billions of dollars in data centers as they train artificial intelligence models .  Microsoft has continued its heavy investments in AI infrastructure this quarter . The company plans to spend $80 billion in fiscal 2025 on construction of data centers designated for AI workloads . AI isn’t going away…which means datacenter demand isn't going away . Invest accordingly .  Oil prices have fallen roughly 20% this year . Shares of AMD jumped as much as 4.9% at the start of trading Wednesday before paring gains and dropping back to below 1% . For the quarter, the AI chipmaker saw adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $0.96 on revenue of $7.4 billion, ahead of analysts' expectations . The company also said it anticipates Q2 revenue of between $7 .  Analyst Vivek Arya raised his price target on AMD stock to $120 while shares traded around the $100 level Wednesday morning . In April, AMD announced that the Trump administration instituted tighter export controls on AI chips destined for China .  AMD's Data Center segment revenue topped $3.7 billion in Q1 . The segment generated $2.3 billion last year . Shares of AMD are off 18% year to date and 36% over the past 12 months .  AMD's gaming business brought in $647 million versus expectations of $540 million . Analysts were anticipating $2 billion in revenue, up from $1.3 billion in Q1 last year . Computers are currently exempt from tariffs, but the administration has said it could implement duties on semiconductors .  Microsoft is raising the price of its Xbox Series X console by $100 to $599 . The company also said it's raising price of some of its first-party games to $79 from $69 . Sony has increased its PlayStation in Europe, but not in the US .
